title: Create AMS Digital multi-page marketing site centered on client success stories and services (content adapted from provided AMS Digital URLs)

requirements.text: Implement a multi-page site structure that mirrors the provided AMS Digital URLs, using client-side routing so each of these paths renders a dedicated page: / (Home), /about, /portfolio, /blogs, /contact, /customer-reviews, /cookie-policy, /privacy-policy, /amsdigital-profile, /services, and one route per service detail page for every URL provided in the request (e.g., /services/logo-and-branding-design, /services/graphic-design, ... /services/pay-per-click).

quotes:
CREATE - https://www.amsdigital.in/
https://www.amsdigital.in/about.php
https://www.amsdigital.in/portfolio.php
https://www.amsdigital.in/blogs.php
https://www.amsdigital.in/contact_ams.php
https://www.amsdigital.in/customer-reviews.php
https://www.amsdigital.in/cookie-policy.php
https://www.amsdigital.in/privacy-policy.php
https://www.amsdigital.in/amsdigital-profile.php
https://www.amsdigital.in/services.php
https://www.amsdigital.in/services/logo-and-branding-design.php
...

acceptanceCriteria: Navigating directly to each route (browser refresh) renders the correct page without a blank screen
Header and footer appear consistently across all pages
Service detail routes exist for every service URL in the user’s list and do not 404

requirements.text: Refocus the website narrative so the Home page and global messaging primarily highlight client success: make case studies/success stories the central content (above or alongside service promotion), and ensure primary CTAs route users toward viewing case studies and requesting a consultation.

quotes: website should revolve around client sucess.

acceptanceCriteria: Home page hero and at least one additional section explicitly emphasize outcomes/results for clients (not just capabilities)
Primary CTA(s) include a path to Portfolio/Case Studies and a path to Contact/Consultation
Services are presented as supporting the success stories rather than being the sole focus

requirements.text: Create a Portfolio/Case Studies page whose content is extracted and adapted from https://www.amsdigital.in/portfolio.php, including (at minimum) a list/grid of case studies and a case-study detail view (either a dedicated route per case study or an in-page detail pattern) featuring problem/approach/outcome and supporting visuals.
acceptanceCriteria: /portfolio displays multiple case studies derived from the referenced portfolio source (adapted into English as needed)
Each case study can be opened to a detail view that includes a clear outcome/results section
Case studies include at least one visual per item (thumbnail and/or header image) loaded from static assets

requirements.text: Create a Services landing page (/services) and individual service detail pages for all provided service URLs; each service detail page must include: service overview, key deliverables, process/approach, typical outcomes, and a CTA to Contact.
acceptanceCriteria: /services lists all services and links to every service detail page
Each service detail page includes an outcomes/results section and a prominent Contact CTA
No service URL from the user’s list is missing from the site navigation paths

requirements.text: Create dedicated pages for About (/about), Blogs (/blogs), Contact (/contact), Customer Reviews (/customer-reviews), and AMS Digital Profile (/amsdigital-profile), with English user-facing copy adapted from the corresponding provided AMS Digital URLs.
acceptanceCriteria: Each of the listed routes renders a complete page (not placeholder-only) with coherent English content
Customer Reviews page contains multiple review/testimonial entries and highlights client outcomes where possible
Contact page includes a functional contact form UI and clear contact details/CTA (submission can be non-emailing if no email integration exists)

requirements.text: Create dedicated legal/policy pages for /privacy-policy and /cookie-policy (not just on-page anchors), and ensure the footer links navigate to these routes.
acceptanceCriteria: /privacy-policy renders privacy policy content in a readable legal layout
/cookie-policy renders cookie policy content in a readable legal layout
Footer legal links navigate to these routes (not #privacy/#cookies anchors)

requirements.text: Update the global header and footer navigation so it supports the new multi-page structure: include links to Home, About, Services, Portfolio, Blogs, Customer Reviews, and Contact; ensure mobile navigation supports the same destinations.
acceptanceCriteria: Header nav links route to the correct pages (and do not rely on single-page section scrolling for primary navigation)
Mobile menu includes the same primary destinations as desktop
Footer link groups include working links for Services, Company, and Legal pages

requirements.text: Centralize all extracted/adapted site content (case studies, services, blog posts, reviews) into maintainable data modules (e.g., typed TS objects), and render pages from this data rather than hard-coding large text blocks inside components.

quotes: included client success story and services provided.

acceptanceCriteria: Portfolio, Services, Blogs, and Reviews pages are driven primarily by shared data structures
Content is easy to update without editing multiple components
TypeScript types exist for core content entities (case study, service, blog post, review)

requirements.text: Apply a cohesive, distinct visual theme (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) suitable for a modern digital agency and consistent across all new pages; avoid a blue/purple-dominant palette.

quotes: website should revolve around client sucess.

acceptanceCriteria: All pages share a consistent design system (headings, body text, cards, buttons, sections)
The chosen palette is not primarily blue/purple
Portfolio/case study pages look visually premium and emphasize readability and outcomes

requirements.text: Add and render the required generated images as static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated, and use them on the Home and Portfolio pages (hero visual and case-study thumbnails).
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images exist in frontend/public/assets/generated with the specified filenames
Home and Portfolio pages load these images directly from static assets (not via backend)
Case study listings display a consistent thumbnail treatment across breakpoints

constraints: Do not edit files in frontend immutablePaths (including frontend/src/main.tsx and frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts[x]). Compose new components/pages around them.
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (backend/main.mo). Add backend features only if strictly necessary for the requested pages/content.
Use English for all user-facing text.
nonGoals: Implementing third-party authentication beyond Internet Identity
Adding a CMS, external database, or third-party blog platform integration
Implementing real-time chat, push notifications, or email sending integrations

required: Modern agency hero illustration with abstract shapes and subtle success/metrics motifs (ams-hero-visual.dim_1600x900.png)
Set of 6–9 case study thumbnail images in a consistent style (ams-case-thumb-set.dim_1200x800.png)
Minimal icon set for services in a consistent outline style (ams-services-icons-sprite.dim_1024x1024.png)
